      • POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL

        private static final int POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL
        Constant defined in fadvise.h and suggest that the specified data will be accessed sequentially (with lower offsets read before higher ones). For more info check man page for posix_fadvise.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • posix_fadvise

        private static int posix_fadvise​(int fd,
                                 long offset,
                                 long len,
                                 int flag)
                          throws com.sun.jna.LastErrorException
        Declare an access pattern for file data. Announce an intention to access file data in a specific pattern in the future, thus allowing the kernel to perform appropriate optimizations. The advice applies to a region starting at offset and extending for len bytes (or until the end of the file if len is 0) within the file referred to by fd. The advice is not binding; it merely constitutes an expectation on behalf of the application.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor
        offset - offset in the file
        len - advise len in bytes
        flag - advise options
        Returns:
        0 on success. On error, an error number is returned
        Throws:
        com.sun.jna.LastErrorException

      • posix_fallocate

        private static int posix_fallocate​(int fd,
                                   long offset,
                                   long len)
                            throws com.sun.jna.LastErrorException
        Ensures that disk space is allocated for the file referred to by the file descriptor fd for the bytes in the range starting at offset and continuing for len bytes. After a successful call to posix_fallocate, subsequent writes to bytes in the specified range are guaranteed not to fail because of lack of disk space. If the size of the file is less than offset+len, then the file is increased to this size; otherwise the file size is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor
        offset - offset in the file
        len - len in bytes
        Returns:
        returns zero on success, or an error number on failure
        Throws:
        com.sun.jna.LastErrorException

      • strerror_r

        public static long strerror_r​(int errnum,
                              long buffPtr,
                              int buffLength)
        Return pointer to a string describing error number, possibly using the LC_MESSAGES part of the current locale to select the appropriate language.
        Parameters:
        errnum - error number to describe
        buffPtr - pointer to error message buffer
        buffLength - length of error message buffer

      • tryEvictFromCache

        public NativeCallResult tryEvictFromCache​(int fd)
        Description copied from interface: NativeAccess
        Try to evict cached pages of file referenced by provided file descriptor. Useful for files that we do not need to access ever again. For example: log files, WAL files, etc.
        Specified by:
        tryEvictFromCache in interface NativeAccess
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor
        Returns:
        returns zero on success, or an error number on failure

      • tryAdviseSequentialAccess

        public NativeCallResult tryAdviseSequentialAccess​(int fd)
        Description copied from interface: NativeAccess
        Try to advice that file referenced by provided file descriptor will be accessed in a sequential fashion. Useful for files that we will read from start to the end sequentially. For example: WAL files.
        Specified by:
        tryAdviseSequentialAccess in interface NativeAccess
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor
        Returns:
        returns zero on success, or an error number on failure

      • tryAdviseToKeepInCache

        public NativeCallResult tryAdviseToKeepInCache​(int fd)
        Description copied from interface: NativeAccess
        Try to advice that file referenced by provided file descriptor will be accessed again in the near future and we will need those pages again. Useful for files that we will read from start to the end sequentially. For example: WAL files.
        Specified by:
        tryAdviseToKeepInCache in interface NativeAccess
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor
        Returns:
        returns zero on success, or an error number on failure
